intro: Ruellia setigera, commonly known as the zigzag ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, attracting various pollinators. Ruellia setigera thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and prolonged flowering period.
